moves.2. e5: Pc5 is a popular response for black.
moves.3. Be2 f6 4. d4 g6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Nc3 f5 7: Not counting pawns white has three pieces on the field.  Black has one.
moves.8. O-O Bxg5 9. h4: Highly questionable.  Best not to disrupt the castle pawns, especially when black can have it for free.
moves.9... Bxh4 10. g3 Bg5 11. Nd2: Black is up four, every even trade now favors him.
moves.11... h4 12. gxh4 Bxh4 13. Bb5+: Easily defended.  Bf3 might have been better.
moves.13... c6 14. Ba4: It is now force mate in three.
moves.15... Bxf2+: Qh5 is, of course, pointless.  Fast game.
